alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:26AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Linn, central Delaware and northwestern Jones Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1224 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Delaware, or near Manchester, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Delhi around 1230 AM CDT Monticello around 1255 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hopkinton and Langworthy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
